definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: You slobbered all over me on the News Line New York!
sentences.chinese: 你却在纽约新闻热线里对我表现得如此露骨。

sentences.english: We draw adiabats that divide the cycle into adjacent strips.
sentences.chinese: 我们画许多绝热线将循环分割成若干相邻的狭条。

sentences.english: Do you have any suggestions on QAD hot line support?
sentences.chinese: 您对QAD热线支持有任何意见和建议吗？

sentences.english: Chinese and Russian environmental protection departments have also set up a hotline link.
sentences.chinese: 中俄环保部门还建立了热线联系。

sentences.english: The calibration of hot-wire probe is also given in this p…
sentences.chinese: 文中还介绍了热线探针的校正方法。

sentences.english: A telephone helpline has been set up for anyone concerned about friends or relatives on 0800 3894193.
sentences.chinese: 电话服务热线被设置成任何关心朋友和亲戚的人联系。

sentences.english: The directional sensitivity of hot-wire effects the measurement accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 热线的方向系数对湍流测量精度很有大的影响。

sentences.english: There is still no hotline between China's armed forces and the Pentagon in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 而中国军方和华盛顿五角大楼间仍然没有这种热线。

sentences.english: The authorities have even encouraged citizens to rat on violators through a new telephone hotline.
sentences.chinese: 政府甚至鼓励市民通过热线电话举报违反禁烟令的人。

sentences.english: Registration plates are picked willy-nilly from a directory and announced on television – and a special restriction hotline.
sentences.chinese: 随机选号的结不美观在电视和热线电话上发布。

sentences.english: All stainless steel body , heavy duty heating element and temperature control function.
sentences.chinese: 不锈钢炉身，高效能发热线及温控功能。

sentences.english: The curve crosses the adiabatics group.
sentences.chinese: 此有限曲线与绝热线族截交。

sentences.english: Beware India, the hotlines may turn too hot to handle in the future.
sentences.chinese: 印度要小心，热线也许未来会变成烫手山芋。
这里没有求助服务热线。

sentences.english: " The hot line, defense officials say, should be up and running in a couple of weeks.
sentences.chinese: 国防官员表示，热线应该在两三个星期内启动运行。

sentences.english: Kemp, the director of the suicide hot line, agrees with Kaplan.
sentences.chinese: 自杀咨询热线的主管坎普同意卡普兰的看法。

definition: morning newspaper/(in a newspaper's name) Morning Post
special-purpose phone line or communications link/hotline/special rail line (e.g. between airport and city)/CL:條|条[tiao2]
evening newspaper/(in a newspaper's name) Evening News
regular column or segment (in a publication or broadcast program)/program (TV or radio)
